comment: Comprehensive mapping of scanner finding types to CWE IDs for graph enrichment. Maps by finding type (not specific pattern names) to support user-defined patterns.

mappings.description: The software contains hard-coded credentials, such as a password or cryptographic key. This covers all API keys, tokens, and secrets detected by pattern matching regardless of the specific service.
mappings.notes: Matches ANY api key pattern (AWS, GitHub, OpenAI, etc.) including user-defined patterns. The scanner finding type 'git_pattern' covers all secrets found in git history.

mappings.description: The software contains a hard-coded password which compromises system security.
Login pages or authentication endpoints do not use adequate measures to protect credentials during transmission.

mappings.cwe_name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
mappings.description: The product exposes sensitive information to an actor that is not explicitly authorized to have access to that information.
The application stores sensitive information in cleartext.

mappings.cwe_name: Inclusion of Sensitive Information in Source Code
mappings.description: Source code comments or configuration files may contain sensitive information such as passwords or API keys.
mappings.notes: Covers secrets found in JavaScript files, source maps, and exposed config files.

mappings.cwe_name: Exposure of Information Through Directory Listing
mappings.description: Server configuration exposes sensitive headers or metadata.

mappings.cwe_name: Sensitive Cookie in HTTPS Session Without 'Secure' Attribute
mappings.description: Cookies without secure flag can be transmitted over insecure channels.
Global variables exposed in browser context can be accessed by malicious scripts.
